page.title: 18Growing up in Stowmarket
page.content: Education is organized in three layers, children start Primary School at the age of five, they move on to Middle School at the age of nine and to the High School four years later. There are several activities available in the evenings. Apart from sports clubs and uniformed groups there Youth Club for those of the age of thirteen or over, and a weekly disco at the Maltings for those sixteen and over. Many young people go to Ipswich to support the football team. However teenagers feel a great lack of a social centre for those who do not wish to commit themselves to clubs. They would like a place to meet for discos or just to talk.
